YES
NO

Question goes here
Do you find it difficult to reduce the amount of time you spend on your smartphone?
Do you often find yourself mindlessly scrolling through your smartphone without a specific purpose?
Do you feel anxious if you forget or misplace your smartphone?
Do you check your smartphone as the first thing in the morning and the last thing at night?
Do you use your smartphone while driving or crossing the road, even if it\'s unsafe?
You\'re on a date, and your date seems uninterested in conversation, constantly checking their smartphone. Would you address this behavior or ignore it?
Do you neglect other responsibilities (e.g., work, household chores) due to excessive smartphone use?
If you\'re running late for an important meeting, and your smartphone battery is almost dead, would you take the time to charge it or head to the meeting without your smartphone?
Do you often ignore face-to-face conversations because you are engrossed in your smartphone?
You see a distressing post on social media about a friend. Would you immediately reach out to them or wait to see if others respond first?
Do you feel a constant need to share updates or check for likes/notifications on social media?
You have a deadline for a project, but a new trending game just got released. Would you play the game or focus on meeting the deadline?
Do you prefer spending time on your smartphone rather than spending time with loved ones?
A friend invites you to a last-minute event, but you already made plans to relax and disconnect from technology. Would you change your plans to attend the event or decline the invitation?
Do you experience physical discomfort (e.g., eye strain, headache) due to prolonged smartphone use?
You\'re out for a meal with friends, and everyone is engrossed in their smartphones. Would you suggest putting away the phones and engaging in the conversation?
You receive a notification about a flash sale for an item you\'ve been wanting. However, it\'s during working hours. Would you take a break to make the purchase or wait until after work?
Do you feel a constant need to capture and share every significant life event or moment on your smartphone?
You receive a call during an important meeting. Would you excuse yourself to answer the call or let it go to voicemail and call back later?

You\'re at a beautiful scenic location, and your instinct is to capture the moment on your smartphone. Would you take a few quick photos or immerse yourself in the experience without using your phone?
Do you use your smartphone to escape from negative feelings or emotions?
Have others expressed concern about the amount of time you spend on your smartphone?
Do you often lose track of time while using your smartphone?
Do you frequently use your smartphone during social interactions or at inappropriate times?
Do you experience anxiety or restlessness when you are unable to use your smartphone?
